info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 9:36AM EDT until August 5 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington and Richland.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Camden, Winnsboro, Springdale, Dentsville, St. Andrews, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Lake Wateree Dam, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Elgin and Arcadia Lakes. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 100 and 120. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 48 and 94. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 44. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Fairfield, SC; Kershaw, SC; Lexington, SC; Richland, SC
